source.author: Hilary George-Parkin
source.title: The fallout from the Suez Canal ship is coming to a store near you

exampleSentences.sentence: So far, the companies that have reported having shipments held up range from IKEA to heavy-equipment maker Caterpillar, potentially setting back building construction alongside home-improvement projects.

source.author: Christina Mackenzie
source.title: This fast French military boat can crawl from water to land without wheels

exampleSentences.sentence: The answer was to give the boat retractable caterpillar treads so it can rumble down the beach and into the water without needing to be towed.

source.author: Curtis Segarra
source.title: Monarch caterpillars head-butt each other to fight for scarce food

exampleSentences.sentence: Competition can be tough, he adds, because monarch caterpillars are limited in their food options.

source.author: Curtis Segarra
source.title: Monarch caterpillars head-butt each other to fight for scarce food

exampleSentences.sentence: If there isn’t enough food from the one plant to feed several caterpillars, “they won’t make it,” he says.

source.author: Rebecca E. Hirsch
source.title: Pesticides contaminate most food of western U.S. monarchs

exampleSentences.sentence: More testing is needed to learn how the different pesticides affect a caterpillar or the adult butterfly, he cautions.
What of the infinite goodness of God in teaching the grub of the ichneumon-fly to eat up the cabbage caterpillar alive?
The man is as ugly as a caterpillar; but he has done me the most immense service a woman can receive from a man.
The caterpillar produces silk, though it is not equal to that of the better known silkworm.
Grimm has recorded that in old German, the caterpillar was named Alba, and that the Alp often takes the form of a butterfly.
Luther, taking up a caterpillar, said: "'Tis an emblem of the devil in its crawling, and bears his colours in its changing hue."

source.title: The World's Greatest Books, Vol X
source.author: Various
